result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick J Johnson

records.addlTxt: 10:14 AM Defendant Derrick J Johnson in court with attorney Kyle E Jesinski.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Michael Schulz appeared by Zoom video for the State of Wisconsin.  Derrick J Johnson appeared by Zoom video means with Attorney who also appeared by Zoom video.  The parties agreed to have the hearing conducted remotely under the Standing COVID-19 Order requirements. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  State presents the offer.  Atty. Jesinski confirms the offer as placed on the record.  Dismissed and Read-in to: 13CM2228.  Court also notes that the bail poster filed a letter and is requesting the bail on deposit be refunded to her.  Atty. Jesinski advises he has no objection to the request.  Defendant presents statements and is requesting to have the $500.00 applied to his fines.  Atty. Jesinski presents additional statements.  Court will order the $500.00 cash bail be applied to the defendant's fine and court costs in case 13CM2228.
Letter from the State requesting a bail review hearing.
Notice and Order for All Criminal Cases (CF) and (CM) signed by Judge Maria S. Lazar 04/27/2020
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 27, 2020 at 09:30 am.

09:12 AM Defendant Derrick J Johnson in court with attorney Kyle E Jesinski.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Jesinski advises the court of the status of the case; he is hoping to be able to resolve the cases quickly.  Court allows ADA Osborne time to review the case to see if there is an offer he can provide defense today.  Atty. Jesinski is requesting a plea and sentencing date in about 2 months.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 27, 2020 at 09:30 am.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Hearing scheduled for January 30, 2020 at 09:00 am.
